channel.title: CyberNetSec - Data Breach
channel.description: Latest data breach threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Data of Nearly 200,000 Supporters of Hungarian Party TISZA Leaked Online
item.description:
The personal data of nearly 200,000 supporters of the Hungarian political party TISZA has been leaked and is being widely distributed online. The breach, which occurred in October 2025, originated from the party's "TISZA Világ" service. The compromised dataset, containing 198,500 records, has been a...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: U.S. Congressional Budget Office Breached by Suspected Foreign Actor
item.description:
The U.S. Congressional Budget Office (CBO), the nonpartisan agency that provides economic analysis to Congress, confirmed on November 6, 2025, that it suffered a significant cybersecurity breach. The attack is suspected to be the work of a foreign government, raising concerns about espionage and the...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: Washington Post Confirms Breach in Cl0p's Oracle Supply Chain Attack
item.description:
The Washington Post confirmed on November 6, 2025, that it was a victim of the widespread supply chain attack orchestrated by the Cl0p ransomware gang. The attack exploited a zero-day vulnerability in Oracle's E-Business Suite (EBS), a widely used enterprise software platform. This confirmation came...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Ransomware, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Swedish IT Firm Breach Exposes Data of 1.5 Million, Sparks GDPR Probe
item.description:
The Swedish IT services firm Miljödata has suffered a severe data breach, exposing the personal and potentially sensitive information of over 1.5 million people. The incident, which occurred in late August, resulted in the stolen data being published on the darknet. In response, the Swedish Data Pro...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Hackers Claim Breach and Full Database Theft from Russian Nuclear Waste Facility 'Radon'
item.description:
A threat actor has posted on a data leak forum claiming to have breached Radon, a Russian state-owned enterprise responsible for nuclear waste management and operated by the nuclear giant Rosatom. The attackers allege they have stolen the company's entire database, which reportedly includes sensitiv...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: SK Telecom Profit Plummets 90% Following Massive Data Breach Affecting 27 Million Customers
item.description:
South Korean telecom giant SK Telecom has reported a catastrophic 90% drop in its Q3 operating profit, directly attributing the loss to the massive costs of a data breach that exposed the personal data of 27 million customers. The breach, which went undetected for nearly three years, involved 25 dif...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: Everest Ransomware Hits Swedish Power Grid Operator, Steals 280GB of Data
item.description:
Sweden's national electricity operator, Svenska kraftnät, has confirmed a data breach following a claim by the Everest ransomware group. The attackers alleged on their dark web leak site that they had stolen 280 GB of internal data. Svenska kraftnät stated that the attack was confined to an external...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: Penn Data Breach: Hacker Claims 1.2M Donor Records Stolen, Exposes "Terrible Security"
item.description:
A threat actor has claimed responsibility for a massive data breach at the University of Pennsylvania, asserting they have stolen the personal and financial data of 1.2 million donors and alumni. The breach was first revealed after offensive emails were sent from a university system hosted on Salesf...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Polish Government Confirms "Very Serious" Data Breach at SuperGrosz Loan Platform
item.description:
Polish authorities, led by the Deputy Prime Minister, have confirmed a "very serious" data breach at the online loan platform SuperGrosz. The attack resulted in the theft of a vast repository of sensitive customer information, including full names, national identification (PESEL) numbers, ID card de...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Regulatory

item.title: Akira Ransomware Claims Breach of Apache OpenOffice, Threatens Data Leak
item.description:
The prolific Akira ransomware group has listed Apache OpenOffice, a popular open-source office suite, as a victim on its dark web data leak site. The threat actors claim to have exfiltrated 23 gigabytes of data from the Apache Software Foundation, including financial records, internal documents, and...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor
